Instructions for installing OpenVPN on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system using the universal ./configure method are as follows:

1. First, expand the .tar.gz file:
   ```
   tar xfz openvpn-[version].tar.gz
   ```

2. Then, cd to the top-level directory and type:
   ```
   ./configure
   ```

3. Next, run the following commands to build and install:
   ```
   make
   make install
   ```

1. Download the OpenVPN source code from: https://openvpn.net/community-downloads/
2. Make sure you have the required dependencies installed:
   - TUN and/or TAP driver
   - OpenSSL library (version 0.9.8 or higher)
   - Optional: PolarSSL library, LZO compression library
3. Clone the OpenVPN repository:
   - git clone https://github.com/OpenVPN/openvpn
4. Build the project from tarball:
   - ./configure
   - make
   - make install

Required Steps to Install OpenVPN from Source on Debian/Ubuntu Linux:

1. Update the system:
   - Command: apt-get update

2. Install required build dependencies:
   - Command: apt-get install libssl-dev liblzo2-dev libpam0g-dev build-essential -y

3. Get the latest OpenVPN source:
   - Visit the OpenVPN Downloads page and download the latest source tarball.
   - Command: wget https://swupdate.openvpn.org/community/releases/openvpn-2.3.12.tar.gz
   - Command: tar xf openvpn-2.3.12.tar.gz

4. Move to the extracted directory:
   - Command: cd openvpn-2.3.12

5. Create the Makefile and check dependencies:
   - Command: ./configure --prefix=/usr
   - Command: make
   - Command: make install

6. Check the installed OpenVPN version:
   - Command: openvpn --version

7. Create the default OpenVPN configuration folder:
   - Command: mkdir /etc/openvpn
   - Command: mkdir -p /run/openvpn/
   - Create the script update-resolv-conf in the /etc/openvpn directory.

8. Make the update-resolv-conf script executable:
   - Command: chmod +x /etc/openvpn/update-resolv-conf

9. Repeat the process periodically to install new versions and stay up to date with OpenVPN.

The webpage does provide instructions on how to install OpenVPN on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system from source code:

1. First, get the script and make it executable:
   ```
   curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/angristan/openvpn-install/master/openvpn-install.sh
   chmod +x openvpn-install.sh
   ```

2. Run the script as root and ensure the TUN module is enabled:
   ```
   ./openvpn-install.sh
   ```

3. Follow the assistant and answer questions to set up the VPN server the first time you run the script.

4. After OpenVPN is installed, running the script again gives the option to:
   - Add a client
   - Remove a client
   - Uninstall OpenVPN

5. Configuration files (.ovpn files) for clients can be found in the home directory.

6. Download the .ovpn files from the server and connect using an OpenVPN client.
